title: Getting Started
description: Install and configure Askify in your Slack workspace

content.text: Before installing Askify, ensure you have:

items: Admin access to your Slack workspace
PostgreSQL database (we recommend Supabase for easy setup)

content.text: Askify is a self-hosted Slack bot. Follow these steps to get it running:

content.value:
git clone https://github.com/jnahian/askify-bot.git
cd askify-bot
npm install

content.text: Copy the example environment file and fill in your credentials:
You'll need to configure these variables:

items: SLACK_APP_TOKEN - App-level token for Socket Mode (xapp-...)

content.value:
npm run prisma:migrate
npm run prisma:generate

content.text: Follow these steps in your Slack workspace:

items: Go to api.slack.com/apps and create a new app
Enable Socket Mode and generate an app-level token
Add bot token scopes: chat:write, commands, channels:read, users:read, im:write
Subscribe to bot events: app_home_opened, message.im

content.text: For production deployment, use 'npm run build' followed by 'npm start'. See the Deployment guide for Docker instructions.
Once Askify is running, create your first poll in any Slack channel:
This opens the poll creation modal. Configure your poll settings and click Create!
Now that Askify is installed, explore these guides:

items: Learn about the four poll types
Save polls as templates for quick reuse
